Posts.Content: Hello Everyone I am starting Chemotherapy next week for breast cancer, EC every 3 weeks I would be very grateful for any advice given on the forum for reducing side effects or any other  advice, however small. Somebody mentioned that eating while having the infusion reduces side effects, has anyone come across that ? Thank you for those who responded already on the other discussion line Suzie
Posts.Title: tips to reduce side effects before starting chemo, please

Posts.Content: Thank you Cathy Useful tips and thank you for your good wishes Hugs too Suzie
Posts.Title: tips to reduce side effects before starting chemo, please

Posts.Content: Hello Pauletta and Loubag Thank you for the feedback on your experiences. I heard about the 2 day fasting, I think my only worry is that I weigh 38 kg ( I am petite) and the fast will bring my weight down very quickly. Worth considering though as the fasting is meant to enhance the chemo attacking the cancer cells. I have a wig ( nhs voucher)but I was interested in the fringe wig and hat, where did you purchase the fringe wig from please? Like you Loubag, I am trying to stay positive, its hard work though because the fear/anxiety can take over ! Thank you for your kind wishes I hope your next treatments will also be kind to you hugs Suzie
Posts.Title: tips to reduce side effects before starting chemo, please

Posts.Content: Hello Maggie I haven't started chemo yet, that will be next week for me. I did have a lumpectomy though All the best Maggie Suzie x
Posts.Title: tips to reduce side effects before starting chemo, please

Posts.Content: Hi Suzeanna I am grateful to you for sharing your experience. Whereas, it sounds like it was the correct decision as 15 had cancer cells, the side effects don't sound very pleasant ! Hindsight is a great thing, but knowing where you are now...would you have made the same decision or perhaps requested less nodes removed ? Did you have level 1 to 3 removed? And had the cancer spread to your lymph nodes on diagnosis? I do hope you find a solution to your  symptoms and they are alleviated Suzie xx
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: HiWeeblemum Thanks for sharing. When they decided not to do the clearance , is that because at the time of diagnosis there was no spread to any lymph nodes ?
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi Helen Could you please share some info about the POSNOC trial you mentioned, how did you get onto it and which hospital is it currently running at. Am I right you have no say in which category you are placed or do you? All the best with clearing your other lymph nodes Suzi
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hello FC59 Sorry I can't help with your question of seroma ( I guess you mean lymphedema ?). I read your post with interest because I was speaking  to  my surgeon about not having a full axillary clearance, so I am keen about hearing of this targeted procedure. You mentioned nothing to be removed of the original tumour, so how much of the original did they remove when you had the lumpectomy, in terms of size? Could you please mention who the surgeon was and which hospital? They sound very up with the latest techniques? Hope your seroma gets sorted out and speedy recovery Suzie
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi TIA, I am in the same position as you. I really don't want axillary clearance as I only have one sentinal node positive. I went to see a surgeon privately hoping that he may agree to removing only the sentinal but he felt it would be unethical for him to do so. I understand his position but I am still seeking a surgeon who has a different approach like your surgeon with a new school of thought. My question is, would your surgeon actually follow through if after the adjuvant chemo, they clear? I would be immensely grateful if you could you please share what the new adjuvant chemo is and the name of the surgeon/ hospital.
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi  Its great that  to have been given the choice of whether to opt out of node clearance. And thanks for the information about the protocol in America, its good to know. I don't want a clearance and have only one node which showed up as having microscopic cancer in a biopsy, but the surgeon insists on a clearance. I am looking for a surgeon who may be willing to offer me the choice of not having a clearance and don't mind travelling .Could you share which hospital you are at and the name of surgeon, if possible please? Suzi x
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hello Everyone I wanted to start a new discussion but for some reason, access was denied, so I am responding instead I am starting Chemotherapy next week for breast cancer, EC and herceptin. I would be very grateful for any advice given on the forum for reducing side effects or any other  advice, however small. Somebody mentioned that eating while having the infusion reduces side effects, has anyone come across that ? thank you Suzie
Posts.Title: Mum has started chemo...

Posts.Content: Hello Cloecat << Also read that primary cancers send out inhibitors to stop the growth of metastatic disease so if you ‘cut out’ the primary the metasteses get to grow.>> Would you please send me a link to the paper that mentions the above, I am interested in reading that. Also could you private message me, as I want to ask you something. I just don't know how to do that on this forum many thanks Suzi
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hello Winterwolfsoul I haven't followed your treatment as I am new on the forum but I was interested to read that you are on Letrozole which you mentioned was least invasive. I am not sure what your cancer is but wanted to know whether you were first offered something more invasive but you got something less invasive? Were they both offered to you? Could you please explain how you managed to have a less invasive form of chemo.... thanks Suzie
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative
